member.name: T:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice
member.summary:
Pipetting/Gripper Combi Y/Z device class.
The Pipetting/Gripper Combi Y/Z device is a complex device used for pipetting and item transfer. It is a special Y/Z device with an additional Z motor.
member.details:
\ingroup Dev_CombiArm
It includes a Y-, Z-, GripperZ- and gripper motor as well as a pipetting pump.\n
The Pipetting/Gripper Combi Y/Z device is derived from a standard Y/Z device. In addition to the Y/Z device members the gripper Y/Z class implements - ... .
%SCombiYZDevice class diagram
\image html "SCombiYZDevice.png"
member.remarks: The Gripper Y/Z device move methods will not take care about the Gripper tool X and Y offsets, but it cares about the Z offset. This is important for the travel height!

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.Init(Sias.BaseDev.SDeviceInitOptions)
member.summary: Init gripper Y/Z device. This first calls the base initialization method initializing the Z, X and Y motor. Then it initializes the gripper and rotation motor.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: GripperZMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.PrepareTravelMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare Z motor travel move if necessary. This method makes sure, that the Z motor moves at least to the defined travel height. If the Z motor is above the defined travel height it will not move.

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.GripperZWorktablePos(System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate Z desk position from a given Z motor position.

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.GripperZMotorPos(System.Double)
member.summary: Calculate Z motor position from a given Z desk position.

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.RMotorPos(System.Double)
member.summary: Convert rotation worktable coordinate to a rotation motor position.

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.RWorktablePos(System.Double)
member.summary: Convert a rotation motor position to a rotation worktable coordinate.

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.GMotorPos(System.Double)
member.summary: Convert gripper worktable coordinate to a gripper motor position.

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.GWorktablePos(System.Double)
member.summary: Convert a gripper motor position to a gripper worktable coordinate.

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.PrepareRMove(System.Double,System.Byte,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Move gripper R motor to a rotation worktable coordinate.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: RMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.PrepareGMove(System.Double,System.Byte,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Move Gripper G motor to a Gripper worktable coordinate.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: GMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.CloseGripper(System.Double)
member.summary: Close handler. The method closes the handler. An upcoming error will be ignored.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: GMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.OpenGripper(System.Double)
member.summary: Open handler. The method opens the handler. An upcoming error will be ignored.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: GMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.PlateCheck(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Plate check.
The method checks if the handler finds a plate. If finding a plate the method returns the optimal close value else it returns the open value.
member.remarks: The device gets locked/unlocked in this method. Timeout: GMotor.ActionLockTimeout

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.XRotateOffset(System.Double)
member.summary: Additional X-Offset (typically coming from gripper tool offsets) depending on the gripper rotation.
member.returns: The X-Offset for the given rotation

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.YRotateOffset(System.Double)
member.summary: Additional Y-Offset (typically coming from gripper tool offsets) depending on the gripper rotation.
member.returns: The Y-Offset for the given rotation

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.Sias#GripArm#IGripYZDevice#PrepareYMove(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Prepare Y motor move to an absolute worktable position. Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.

member.name: M:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.Sias#GripArm#IGripYZDevice#CheckZRange(System.Double)
member.summary: This method checks and optionally limits the Z range without giving an error. In case of changing the position a warning is logged.
member.returns: Optionally limited absolute destination worktable position

member.summary: Prepare Z motor move to an absolute worktable position. Take care there are no position validation checks. If there is another component blocking the way you may get a movement blocked error.

member.summary: Gripper motor scaling offset property.

member.name: P:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.GInitOffset
member.summary:
Gripper motor init offset property.
The gripper motor init offset is used before gripper init to optionally open the gripper. This shoucan drop an available item before init the gripper. \n
member.remarks: Note: Initializing the gripper motor with an gripped item would result in incorrect gripper motor positions!

member.name: P:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.GripCheckOffset
member.summary: Grip check offset property. This offset defines the additional close offset to check if the gripping was successfully or not. It needs to be high enough to get the motor blocked.

member.name: P:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.GripperTool
member.summary:
Actual gripper tool property.
This property defines the actual gripper tool, mostly this gripper tool is fix connected to the gripper Y/Z device. Typically the gripper tool will change/define the position offsets for gripping components. As the GripperTool can also pick other gripper tools this may again change the position offsets.

member.summary: Default execution group for the Gripper Y/Z Device property.

member.summary:
Name of the Arm device.
Changing the name of the arm device results in changing the names of all connected sub devices.

Y safety margin property
Gripper Y/Z devices may need an Y safety margin depending on the rotation and the gripper value.

member.summary: Current item property. This property gets/sets the current item gripped with this gripper Y/Z device. If no item is gripped the property should be (set to) null.

member.name: F:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiYZDevice.ErrorCodes.NoPlateFound
member.summary: 0x2014: No plate found! The gripper motor did not get blocked at plate check.

member.name: T:Sias.CombiArm.SCombiArmDevice
member.summary:
Combination arm device class.
The combination arm device is a complex device representing a mixture between pipetting arm and handler arm.
member.details:
\ingroup Dev_CombiArm
A combination arm has an X motor and at least one pipetting and one gripper Y/Z sub device.
In addition to the arm device's members the combination arm implements - a pipetting methods property including - a configuration property for its default wash station - a configuration property for the default aspiration offset - an OK-tip-map property defining the actually usable pipetting devices - a set of low level routines for moving tips, picking liquid ... - a set of high level tool box functions for easier programming special aspirate or dispense methods - a set of high level methods like Aspirate, Dispense, Flush, ... working directly using layout objects (mostly cavities). . - and a handling methods property including - configuration properties for connected gripper Y/Z device, - methods for getting dropping and moving items . .
\image html "SCombiArmDevice.png"
TODO: Add support for restricted areas
member.remarks: \b Remark: To make sure that the tips are out of the range of accessible objects before releasing the access mode it is needed to define a gripper path.
